info.author: Charanpal Dhanjal
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU Library or Lesser General Public License (LGPL)
info.description:
SpPy is a sparse matrix library based on the C++ library Eigen with a similar interface to NumPy. Here is a code snippet: 
        
        :: 
        
            >>> import numpy 
            >>> from sppy import csarray 
            >>> #Create a new column major dynamic array of float type
            >>> B = csarray((5, 5), storagetype="col") 
            >>> B[3, 3] = -0.2
            >>> B[0, 4] = -1.23
            >>> B[numpy.array([0, 1]), numpy.array([0,1])] = 27
            >>> print(B)
            csarray dtype:float64 shape:(5, 5) non-zeros:4 storage:col
            (0, 0) 27.0
            (1, 1) 27.0
            (3, 3) -0.2
            (0, 4) -1.23
            >>> print(B.sum())
            52.57
        
        More Information 
        ----------------
        
        * See the user guide at http://pythonhosted.org/sppy/
        * The source code is available at https://github.com/charanpald/sppy
info.license: GNU Library or Lesser General Public License (LGPL)
info.name: sppy
info.summary: A sparse matrix package based on Eigen.
info.html_description:
SpPy is a sparse matrix library based on the C++ library Eigen with a similar interface to NumPy. Here is a code snippet:

::

>>> import numpy
>>> from sppy import csarray
>>> #Create a new column major dynamic array of float type
>>> B = csarray((5, 5), storagetype="col")
>>> B[3, 3] = -0.2
>>> B[0, 4] = -1.23
>>> B[numpy.array([0, 1]), numpy.array([0,1])] = 27
>>> print(B)
csarray dtype:float64 shape:(5, 5) non-zeros:4 storage:col
(0, 0) 27.0
(1, 1) 27.0
(3, 3) -0.2
(0, 4) -1.23
>>> print(B.sum())
52.57

More Information
----------------

* See the user guide at http://pythonhosted.org/sppy/
* The source code is available at https://github.com/charanpald/sppy
